Text: Praise the LORD. Praise God in His sanctuary; praise Him in His mighty heavens.
Context: This verse calls for exuberant praise of the Lord, both in His holy place of worship and throughout the heavens, recognizing His omnipresence.

Text: Praise Him for His mighty acts; praise Him for His excellent greatness.
Context: The psalmist exhorts the reader to praise God specifically for His mighty deeds and for the unmatched greatness of His character.

Text: Praise Him with the sound of the trumpet; praise Him with the harp and lyre.
Context: In this verse, musical instruments are introduced as means to express praise to God, indicating the appropriateness of using music in worship.

Text: Praise Him with tambourine and dancing; praise Him with strings and flute.
Context: Similar to the previous verse, a variety of instruments and even dancing are prescribed as expressions of joy in praising God.

Text: Praise Him with clashing cymbals; praise Him with resounding cymbals.
Context: The use of loud and clashing cymbals emphasizes the intensity and vigor that should accompany praise to God.

Text: Let everything that has breath praise the LORD. Praise the LORD.
Context: The final verse concludes with a universal call for all living beings to praise God, serving as a doxological climax to the psalm and, indeed, the entire book of Psalms.
